content: A rectangular garden has a length of 20 feet and a width of 12 feet. What is the perimeter of the garden?

The perimeter of a rectangle is calculated by adding up all its sides. Since a rectangle has two pairs of equal sides, the formula for perimeter is P = 2*(length + width). So, for this garden, the perimeter would be P = 2*(20 + 12) = 2*(32) = 64 feet.
